alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 14 at 4:12AM CST until January 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...North winds 35 to 40 mph with gusts near 60 mph expected along with patchy areas of blowing dust. * WHERE...Greeley and Wichita Counties. * WHEN...From 11 AM MST /noon CST/ this morning to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds are expected and may blow down trees and power lines. Travel may be difficult on east west oriented roads, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: The Kansas Department of Health and Environment recommends that you take preventative measures during this blowing dust event...such as staying indoors or wearing protective breathing masks if outside. High dust concentrations can cause respiratory problems...decrease lung activity...aggravate asthma...and lead to potential heart-related problems...especially with children...elderly...or those with pre-existing respiratory conditions. Use caution if you must drive.
